column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of barlowite, Cu4(OH)6FBr, were synthesised via a hydrothermal reaction as previously reported23.
#Text=Zn-substituted samples, ZnxCu4−x(OH)6FBr, were achieved through the addition of excess ZnBr2 whilst varying the amount of CuBr2 accordingly as detailed in Supplementary Table 1.
#Text=For our fully Zn-substituted sample, x = 0.99(1), the autoclave was heated at 1 K/min to 483 K, held for 24 h and cooled at a rate of 0.1 K/min to room temperature.
#Text=The resulting products, coloured turquoise to pale blue depending on the level of Zn-substitution, were filtered and washed several times with distilled water and dried in air.
